Comments: first record; collected and identified by A.M.F. Aguiar on
Protea magnific
a x susannae (var. Suzara), in Santo da Serra (Santa Cruz) (
19 - 10-2000
); on
Protea cynaroides
, in Caniço (Santa Cruz) (
7 -09- 2000
) and Santana (
22 -08- 2006
); on
Leucadendron tinctum , Protea
sp.,
Protea repens , Protea longifolia
“Satin Pink”, in Santa (
19 - 10-2000
).

Comments: Williams & Granara de
Willink ( 1992 )
reported (pp. 13 ) the presence of this species as
D. alazon
.

.

Comments: although described from specimens collected in Portugal , it is possibly native to Southern Africa (
Mazzeo et al ., 2009
); new record for Madeira, collected and identified by A.M.F. Aguiar on
Leucadendron
sp. in Ribeirinha (Camacha) (
7 -05- 1997
).

Comments: the presence of this mealybug in Mainland reported by
Danzig & Watson ( 2010 )
is confirmed by us: specimens collected by Elisabete Figueiredo on
Capsicum annuum
under greenhouse, in Silveira (Torres Vedras) (
30 - 7-2009
).

).

. Comments: first record for Madeira; collected by António Miguel Franquinho Aguiar, on
Vitis vinifera,
in Encruzilhada (S. Vicente) (
13 - 11-1995
).

Comments:
Balachowsky ( 1939 )
collected this species on
Ficus carica
and reported that, apparently, it was not differentiable from
Pseudococcus citri Risso
v. coleorum Marchal.
Vieira et al . ( 1983 )
did not find it in the Island . This is possibly a misidentification of
Planococcus citri (Risso)
.

Comments: first record; collected by the first author, on
Cupressus
sp., in Monsanto (Lisbon) (
2-10 - 1995
,
8- 11-1995
) and Setúbal (
29 -05- 1995
) and by Filomena Caetano, on
Chamaecyparis
sp., in Restelo (Lisbon) (
6- 11 - 1995
).

References:

Borges et al . ( 2008 )
,
Danzig & Watson ( 2010 )
, Pellizzari & Germain ( 2010 ).

Comments: reported by
Balachowsky ( 1939 )
from specimens collected at Funchal, Câmara de Lobos and S.Vicente, on several ornamental plants and
Trifolium
sp., in 1936 . According to the present knowledge on the
Pseudococcus maritimus
complex (
Miller et al . 1984
,
Gimpel & Miller 1996
) this is possibly a misidentification of
P. viburni .
